title: Can a Chiropractor be sued for fraudulent charges and if so what is their burden of proof?
question: In August of 2016 I was seen by a Chiropractor 3 times. He billed the insurance company for 8 visits. After I settled with the insurance company the bill became my responsibility which is when I discovered the fraud. The have recently reported the balance they say is due to a collections agency which has negatively impacted my credit. They also released my personal records to the collections agency. I'm trying to find out what my rights are and if I have a case for suit.
answers:
Yes. You may sue chiropractor for fraudulent billing.
Burden of proof is preponderance of evidence.
